channel.title: 3 on Carl Müller-Crepon
channel.description: Recent content in 3 on Carl Müller-Crepon

item.title: Rulers on the Road: Itinerant Rule in the Holy Roman Empire, AD 719–1519
item.description: We study the geography of the itineraries of the emperors of the Holy Roman Empire.

item.title: The Train Wrecks of Modernization: Railway Construction and Nationalist Mobilization in Europe
item.description: We study railroad building and separatist mobilization in 19th and 20th century Europe.

item.title: The Future is History: Restorative Nationalism and Conflict in Post-Napoleonic Europe
item.description: We assess how historical “golden ages” affect nationalist territorial claims and conflict.

item.title: Indirect Rule, Cash Crop Production, and Development in Africa
item.description: Indirect colonial rule through precolonial institutions improved the developmental impact of cash crop agriculture.
